lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome guys, glad you could join us tonight. Before we get started on the game tonight, I've got some quick announcements to get through, so bear with us here. First and foremost, we have returning tonight our fantastic sponsor and friend, D&D Beyond! Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As we've previously announced, D&D Beyond is contributing $100 to 826LA for every natural one we roll, and that's a lot! Also, as part of the 826LA charity initiative, now that we're way past our $10,000 tier, D&D Beyond has offered up the discount code "826LA" for 25% off the legendary bundle. The legendary bundle includes all the digital materials available on the D&D Beyond site, so check it out now. A quick history lesson: I did some research. D&D Beyond actually, even though it's a popular modern website, it started in the 80s when D&D started to get popular. It didn't catch on because there was no internet, but they still had the website. They did an ad push for it and I found a script from their earliest ad that they put out. It's a little dated. It's a 1980s ad for D&D Beyond, and me and my friends here are going to act it out for you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Help.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We fade in on a teenager's room. Knock, knock, knock.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Son! Turn down that Whitney Houston tape for a second!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grody to the max, Dad! It's Pet Shop Boys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever. Did you do your homework?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No duh, and now I'm going to watch 21 Jump Street on that brand new TV network, Fox! Richard Grieco is bodacious!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, your friend, Gail, is here to play that game you love.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Punchout? Contra? Operation Wolf?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, the one your Aunt Pam says was invented by Satanists.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, Gail! Where's the beef?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Eat my shorts, dude!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Gail, are you sure D&D is safe? It scares me like rap music by Public Enemy and LL Cool J.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Take a chill pill, Dad! D&D is radical. It's as trustworthy as current Democratic presidential nominee Gary Hart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Now it's even better with D&D Beyond, with high speed internet, WiFi or a smartphone you can access your stats and more on your iPad or laptop.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have any of those things been invented yet?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Gag me with a spoon, Mrs. Henderson.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Righteous! Now I don't even want to go see that brand new movie, The Lost Boys, I just want to play D&D! Cut to Travis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How on earth did you not put a Growing Pains reference in that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is all heavily researched 1987 facts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have another sponsor tonight. We've talked about them a little bit in the past and we're super excited to bring Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire as an awesome sponsor of the show tonight. Once again, from the great Pillars of Eternity series, I was in the first one and all of us are in this one. It comes out very soon, May 8th. It's in the same world, Eora. It's a really fantastic isometric RPG in the classic style of Baldur's Gate. The graphics are beautiful, and the music's incredible. You'd have heard the first game's music all through most of the Critical Role's run so far. It's a great story. For those that have finished the first game, it deals with the god Eothas who is now terrorizing this area called Deadfire. It's very pirate ships and oceanic island travel and it's pretty badass. You get to hear all of us in it and you also get to customize Vox Machina in it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You didn't know!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you played the first game, you also get to carry over your save over into the second one and actually have your character and your choices in the first game connect to the new story, which is pretty rad. Check out the new companion voices, play the incredible story, and customize some characters who look like Vox Machina and also sound like them if you so feel like it. You can check it out and buy it at versusevil.com/criticalrole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They've just revealed the very dashing portrait of Scanlan Shorthalt today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sex personified.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's one of those days. My brain is melting. Yeah, check it out. Vox Machina: Origins number six comic has been out for a week. If you haven't had the chance, check it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've read it. It's good!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love it when you're surprised by your own content. It's my favorite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll have some more announcements soon, hopefully. We hit our goal with 826, the charity we've been doing. We've hit 40K, which means I have to do another fireside chat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a joy, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's true. It is a joy, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sans robe this time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Don't give them ideas.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want sherry or schnapps? Or what do you want?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, we're going port again. That was a good night. We've got that coming up. We're getting a new stretch goal. If we hit 50K in the two next weeks, Marisha will be GMing another Honey Heist game. Super excited for that because that was a lot of fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) The bears are back in town!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we can play this time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, because you guys were out of town last time. That'd be perfect. Remember, if you guys help donate to 826, who are a fantastic organization, our gracious critter, Mark, has matched the donations and has offered to match up to 50K now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?! No! That's too much!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Foster, talks about the previous episode. Next week will be this episode of Critical Role with a few guests from the show to come there and talk about what randomness happened in our brain tonight. Check that out. Podcast of last week's episode is available where all fine podcasts are available for download. To remind you, because it's been a few weeks, I'll be at Otafest at Calgary May 18th to 20th. Not that far from now, just a few weeks. Be seeing some of you Canadian folks. I'll be at A-Kon in Texas June 7th to 10th, so look forward to seeing you guys there. I think, unless there's anything else I missed, that's all the announcements we have in log.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My gosh, you've got a lot going on these days.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Safely, seemingly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He keeps saying seemingly! He keeps saying that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I keep saying that because you weren't there to confirm! I don't want to say that it happened because the mystery's fun. You were brought down through the tunnels to the Underworks, towards an underground dock, where the river that exited to the northeast towards Berleben was. You loaded up on boats to make your way towards a recently uncovered but barely explored underground research facility, long buried. The Gentleman asked you to enter it, see what you found, clear it out if possible, and return. As you made your way down there, assailed by a few of the creatures that existed in that tunnel, you found the exterior of this research facility, broke your way in, began to meander around and discover strange mysteries afoot in its construction. The urns throughout the vicinity, the strange wisps of spiritual energy came to assault you in the process. Bypassing traps, mostly, kind of.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or not at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This semi-skeletal ghostly face of material began to emerge from it. Its voice slowly hissing out, "My secrets are yours." You saw small glows begin to emerge from the ash and to the urns nearest the two of you. That, my friends, is where we last left off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right. We marked our places on the map, where we left last time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We did? I was very intoxicated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this thing emerges here, it doesn't seem to, at the moment, make any sort of aggressive maneuver. What do you do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it have any legs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Imagine a figure that is wrapped in four or five layers of robes, and the robes have been shredded out, all these moving tendrils of cloth and black shadow energy that are spinning around in places. Its center chin and body are stationary. The bottom half of its body seems to taper into nothingness, disappearing into cloth and ever-shifting and whipping material at the base.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you Siff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't answer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He said he wants to tell us secrets or something. I like secrets.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Secrets are fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Secrets make friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (moaning) Glides slowly in your direction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give him something. Information, news, something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a secret for you! Did you know that in Nicodranas the pastries are made with cinnamon and here they're not? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a brief moment where the entity's head, much like a young puppy confused by a rattling sound in the distance, (snapping) in Jester's direction, "A secret for trade."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For trade, what does that mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know what? I'm going to pull the battle map.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cinnamon was his most hated spice!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I gave him a secret!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He fucking hates cinnamon!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! I thought I was helping.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You were. You did great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's drifted up to that point there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's in the teleportation circle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ashley, even you don't believe that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are preparing here, the whispers begin to slowly spill out of its face, voices spreading out. I need Jester, Yasha, and Beau to all make a wisdom saving throw, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My clay pot is glowing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you succeed actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell me something cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Suddenly, the world begins to spin. You feel yourself assaulted from all angles. You see flashes of ancient warfare, of giant columns of fire crashing from the cosmos. You spin your staff around retroactively. I need you to make an attack against Yasha, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry, boo! It's not good, an 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your armor class?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No sorry, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm pretty sure that doesn't hit you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see Beau, suddenly her eyes go wide, swing the staff wide in your direction. You deflect it with your blade.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck you, Genghis Khan!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now I need you all to roll initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wanted to talk!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first conversation wasn't quite what he was looking for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit balls.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Dang it, maybe we can still talk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Conflicted feelings!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The 11 herbs and spices are--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott at the top. 20 to 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh, Yasha!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the best thing you've ever rolled on initiative.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten? Oh boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh fuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Run away!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten to five.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sechs

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight for Beau. Six for Caleb. Five both of you, Jester and Molly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was the weirdest, cutest hiccup I've ever heard!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this moment, Nott, you see this entity as it suddenly begins to emanate these whispers into the air. Your friends start all of a sudden grasping their faces. You see Beau try and swing at Yasha. Chaos is breaking loose. What are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (screaming)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are you going?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bonus action dash! Keep going!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Behind that cage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's going to be a thing that comes out there, I think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well, I'll be first to kill it then. Then action, I will hand crossbow up and hold until I see it make an aggressive action towards one of my acquaintances; we're not quite friends yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to know. Yasha, your turn.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are we attacking him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What does Yasha want to do? What is Yasha's instinct?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not see a foot on his body, no.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shit! Already off to a bad start. You said, "My secrets are yours." Did you want to give us a secret?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've already given you a piece. More?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what he did to Beau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to take out my sword, and I'm going to attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You got it Yasha! Take him down! It's one hit!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's going on at the bottom of his--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's all this action down here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a dormant runic circle that has been lying there. Doesn't seem to be reacting to his presence at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we can activate it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shit, I don't like going first! Okay, I'm going to attack with my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You're holding off on rage?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're raging?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm raging. I would like to rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make your attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kill that floating dude. Maybe he just flies. Maybe he's got feet and his robes cover them up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's tucking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He could tuck.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Eight plus--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus rage damage, ten right? Ten total? You rolled five, plus three for your strength, plus two for your rage. That would be a total of ten.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With which weapon is this?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: My Moon-touched sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is technically baseline magical so-- okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Baseline magical?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: When I say eyes, you now get a look, and it's these vacant holes and this tightly pulled skin against this skeletal face. Black energy is billowing out of it like smoke is slowly pouring out of the sockets. That's your turn?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, that's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now, out of the side cages, these glows all begin to emerge as four more of these wisp entities you had previously encountered in the chamber begin to shift through the cages towards the nearest source of life. This one's going to go towards Nott. This one's going to stay right there with Molly. This one's going to go after Fjord as well as this one there. On that note, against Nott the attack is a seven. That is a low roll; I do not think that hits you. As you see it emerge, you freak out as it swings by and ducks into the wall briefly before re-emerging, shifting through the actual stone. Against Molly-- another seven.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ha ha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's better. That's a 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of them begin to hit you from both sides. You're not quite sure how to defend. One of them seems like it's about to sweep at you. You go to deflect it as the other one slaps into the back of your head as you feel this shock energy hit you in the base of the skull. Your eyes go white for a second. You take 11-- oh no sorry, I rolled the wrong dice for that one. You take five points of lightning damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Excellent. He takes ten points of ice damage, or frozen damage or whatever.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Fro-yo damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the ice crystals coalesce around the outside, not doing quite as much damage as you would have expected.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, from hitting my frozen porcupine armor? That's not great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other one's going to try and use that moment to swing at you and rob you of a little more life force. That is going to be a 12. What is your armor class?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh that misses, 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Miss then. Just swings past you. The orbs now are glowing and sparking, preparing for the next round of assault.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is all the notes from what we learned about Siff Duthar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The next is going to be the entity in the center.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think he is a being of fire and ice, so I bet he's immune to fire and ice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The entity is going to use its Howling Babble ability. Every creature within 30 feet of it that can hear it has to make a wisdom saving throw, so that's all of you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me too?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you hear it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (counting) You're just 30 feet outside of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When it does this, do I release my arrow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I will release my arrow bolt. That's not good, 14?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do I get, 3d6 right? One for the hit and then-- that's 18 points of damage, but it is not a magical weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It damaged it, but something about it being between the planes and its essence is making it not as effectively damageable with regular weaponry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hoo boy. What save were we making?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be the wisdom save.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Eight!

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: We're in so much trouble!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Guys, we're doing fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, Jester, Yasha, and Nott. As this faint energy begins to disperse throughout the chamber, you hear thousands of voices trying to whisper into your ears simultaneously. They're not making sense, and as they weave, your whole body begins to go catatonic. Your muscles tense and you fall to your knees. You're all paralyzed until the end of your next turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no! We're in big trouble, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to fly up and back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, I have a question. When we're paralyzed, does that mean every attack against us is a critical?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every melee is, if it hits. That ends its turn. That brings us to Beau. You're paralyzed, so at the end of your turn it fades. Sorry, not paralyzed, stunned. It's not paralyzed. It's stunned.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Stunned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. It is not-- I had to read--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What can I do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stunned means you can't really do anything this turn, but half make a sentence. You're aware of your surroundings but you can't take actions or move. At the end of your turn, it wears off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to be like: The fire and ice from the book and the lost sword and all that shit, remember?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends Beau's turn?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seeing how terrible everything is around me I stick a quivering hand into my pocket and pull out a little copper wire. I learned how to do this from Nott. I cup it in my hands, and I cast Message to the thing. I'm going to text you what I'm-- only it can hear me and I'm sending it to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Digital whispers!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While backing against the wall behind me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You back up against the wall there. That ends your turn, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will send Frumpkin skittering down by Yasha's feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester and Molly. Jester, you are no longer stunned. That is your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and break the pot in through the cage. I'm going to take a swipe at the pot through the cage with my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The cage, because the slits are very small, you cannot get your full hand in there, so with the blade there you might be able to get it, so make an attack roll with disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just misses. You strike the outside of it, but the blow-- you watch as the urn (rocking in place).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to swing around and try to get another shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull it out and jab once more towards it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stop doing that! You'll get everyone drunk. Even worse. That's actually a natural one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're making so much money tonight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's already $500.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your blades are getting caught in the cage and try to pull it out, the large wisp is slowly pushing towards your body.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run towards-- I'm in combat with it. It gets an attack of opportunity if I run, doesn't it? I'm going to steady myself and prepare for another attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nott, deal with this!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to cast Eldritch Blast into the pot in the bottom of the cage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, with disadvantage because you're aiming through the smaller space. It actually has cover. It's largely just a small space you're shooting through.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's not going to hit, that's a three plus-- 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 does hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh does it? Wait I added that wrong; hold on. (stuttering) I'm pretty sure I added that wrong.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Porky Pig stuttering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your spell attack modifier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah no, that's only a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah that doesn't hit, unfortunately. You're trying to shoot the remainder and manage to hit the bar, and the bar bends back a little bit from the impact of the blast. However, it's not actually hitting the urn on the inside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great, cool, awesome. Can I run? Can I use my speed-- are they both in melee range?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, they are.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll stay right where I am, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, you manage to (grunt) shrug off the stun, but that's the end of your turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, great. I'm sorry I couldn't help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha, you shrug off the stun. That's the end of your turn. All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Ah fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, all the wisps begin to close in once more on their targets. Molly, that's a 23.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a number. Yeah, that hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take six points of lightning damage as it shocks you from the side, again. The other one striking against you, Nott. That is going to be a 15 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 armor class! You manage to duck out of the way of this one as well. This one is beginning to flicker angrily, as it can't seem to grasp and tear any sort of life force from you with shock.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, get away!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two against you Fjord. That is a ten, six plus four.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Misses. The other one is a 16.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (stuttering) That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's five points of lightning damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten points of cold damage to that particular wispy bastard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which it takes a reduced amount. That ends their turn. Now we'll see if the Howling Babble-- It does not regenerate that ability. It does not recharge it. Now as the spectral entity begins to fly back towards this side, it's going to shift over in this direction. We're going to say that it's gliding up near this pillar here. It's about 20 feet up, right by where the ceiling is, and it's glaring down at everybody.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He doesn't make an attack or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's about to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit, oh man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Instead, it's going to coast down towards the one that struck at it last turn. Rush right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are his robes floating around him all cool like a Nazgûl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to go ahead and attempt a Maddening Touch against you, Yasha.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's already raging. She's mad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 16 to hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You suffer-- that's actually a really shitty roll for him. Nine points of psychic damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hmm, that's a shitty roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus three. Sorry, 12 points of psychic damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a less shitty roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then it's going to go ahead and attempt to fly back up into where it was, in the ceiling after it makes its strike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All I'm hearing in my head is Careless Whisper now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you get an attack of opportunity?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Doesn't she have Sentinel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh you would get an attack of opportunity against it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, Sentinel!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, Sentinel feat! Oh, this might fuck it up. As it comes down and strikes at you, you feel this burst of maddening intent shower into your head. It sparks your brain with this horrible searing pain. You guys watch as Yasha screams out and begins to withdraw. With that, she all of a sudden clicks back into reality and swings wide with the sword. What did you roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which means he can't move. The Sentinel feat prevents him from moving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Boom! Speed is zero.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I also add Divine Fury on--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may. Could have done that last round, too, but forgot.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus five, for your strength and rage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (counting) Plus what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus seven, technically.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that a divine thing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Plus seven you said? 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see this glowing pulse of dark energy in the center. As it (guttural wail) it has to fight to reform, its semi-corporeal form. It looks like it's hurt pretty bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh man. Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha, that ends your turn?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was my attack of opportunity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to-- I'm good, right? I'm going to run up and pull out that holy water that I didn't use before. I'm going to parkour off of Yasha's shoulder and spike it right at his feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, go ahead and roll your ranged attack. d20 plus your proficiency.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I don't know if that's good, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Roll 2d6.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll make my body all strong.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes eight points of radiant damage as it splashes on its form. The flames suddenly begin to ignite across the front of its cloaked exterior. Because holy flames are licking up the side of it and burning and it's (rasping cry).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I still have my opportunity attack? I mean my-- Sorry, my secondary attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Usually you get the bonus on a punch. You have to move up to do it though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did move up. I said I ran up next to Yasha and spiked it. I parkoured off her shoulders, spiked it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Good call.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to do flurry of blows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two more punch attacks or unarmed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 19 and 15 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of those hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is an additional six-- Sorry, 12 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 damage. You rush up off the shoulder after slamming it against the ground. You come up with a punch and an uppercut from underneath. As your fists impact, it's like punching through heavy, cold cloth. You feel like almost you're punching nothing as you do. While you're impacting, you're not sure how much damage it's doing. (whoosh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, that's fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn, Beau. Caleb, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't see any difference in it when I did what I did,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't seem to notice anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How close could I get to it, if I wanted to walk straight at it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could get right up to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right up to it. Could I get right behind-- No, I'll get right up to it,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You can get right there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, okay. I'm going to cast Burning Hands, veered away so that it does not touch Yasha. It has to make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a 15 foot cone, correct?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, from the edge of where you'd be would be there, you can technically-- No, it would not quite hit that, but you can hit the creature.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It makes its save. That is a seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's 3d6, halved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did it make it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It rolled a seven on its DC, so no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, no. It did not make it. It takes 11 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11, okay. Half of that. The fire doesn't seem to have as much impact. Largely because of its ghostly form, most things it seems to be resistant towards, but it's still taking damage as you're doing this. Now it's being flanked from all of you guys. That ends Caleb's turn. Jester, Molly, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pots, people, pots?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, we should take those out too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to yelling at everyone: Hit the pots! Hit the bloody pots!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (counting) You have to get over here to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who has that sword we pulled off?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jester.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First off, the will-o'-wisp makes a strike at you, attack of opportunity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I bet he wants his sword back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you rush past, 16 points of lightning damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god, really!?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I rolled double eights on d8s. The will-o'-wisp suddenly, as you try to rush, it actually darts in front of you. You run towards it, and it actually passes through your entire torso. As it does, shocking your lungs and heart, and for a second your heart doesn't beat. Then kicks back in. Your whole body feels cold, but you keep running. You push past Caleb and get right up next to the creature.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Need a defib.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Pots, people. I'm going to take two strikes with the radiant swords. That's a 15 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: An eight to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight does not hit, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The pain is too strong on one strike and you go wide, but you turn around and all of a sudden there's a moment of clarity. As the pain clicks in, you clench your jaw and swing back, striking true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it do extra radiant damage? I mean, because I do an extra bonus radiant damage, if it takes it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do the extra three anyway, because it's undead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, so yeah. That's (counting) 11 points of radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How much is the sword? How much is the radiant?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Six is radiant, and the rest is the sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Between the different attacks you've done it's starting to freak out now. It's trying to figure out how best to deal with its situation. That ends your turn, Molly; Jester, what are you doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to pull out my symbol of the Traveler, and I'm going to say: Okay, I hope you're with me right now, because I really need your help! I'm going to try to Turn Undead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where you're standing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm going to jump up behind Frumpkin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You dart over this direction. What's the radius on that, 30 feet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 30 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll catch all three of those and the guy. Was it wisdom saves against your spell DC?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wisdom save, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't really like my position right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you're in a bad place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It has to make a wisdom saving throw, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Far end will-o'-wisp right there, that would be a six. No. That one, nope. That one over there is going to attempt as well. That's a nine. No, so that one is also turned. The one over there is fleeing. That is going to be a 16. That does succeed?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 16 succeeds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The main guy, natural 20. These two wisps now are slightly-- you rush up, and you pray for a second and hope. You know this inspiration hits you. As you clasp the symbol, suddenly the strange little archway on the top of the symbol begins to glow. There's this large burst of deep blue energy that radiates outward. As it strikes, it washes over the main creature with no effect. As it hits the two other side will-o'-wisps, both of them shiver and begin to shift away. Looking like they're actually running in fear, as fast as they can from Jester, in the center. That's your action.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's my action, and for my bonus action, I'm going to cast Sanctuary on-- who's the lowest?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) You.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw, that was so considerate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not too bad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's the lowest? Blood coming out of her mouth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (as Jester) I'm trying to be a good healer, but me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fair enough. You have Sanctuary on you right now. Jester, that ends your turn. Fjord, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I think that might work, 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 hits, go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten plus four, 14!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, that one pot shatters. The ash explodes in a small cloud, pushing on the side of the wall behind the cage. That one wisp next to you flitters out of existence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With my bonus action, can I move my Hex onto el shadow figure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Disadvantage on wisdom saving throws.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, wisdom ability checks, not saving throws.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wisdom ability checks, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage on wisdom ability checks. That ends your turn Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's four pots? Now there's three. Can I see any of them from where--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. Inside the cage you can see one there, and you assume there's one in there because you saw Molly going towards it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will shoot one of the pots with my hand crossbow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which you can do without disadvantage, because of your feat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, a lot, 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well you still have disadvantage to try and fire at it, because it's in the cage. Sorry, I just realized. It's in the cage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Doesn't he have crossbow advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's for melee stuff. This is it being covered, and you're aiming through these tiny holes as you're firing at it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It has half-cover or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well essentially. Yeah, I'd say at this close it has three-quarters cover. It's a plus five to its AC. What did you roll?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The first roll was 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it hits. We'll say it hits, because you're right up against it with a crossbow. You're not having to aim in with it. You're (bolt flying). Roll the damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Six points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six is enough. The pots aren't very strong; it's just hard to touch (shattering). That will-o'-wisp manages to discorporate next to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight is Enough. I'll skitter around towards the candelabra over there, and as I go I'll (cocks crossbow) and fire another shot at the other pot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that one you do have disadvantage on as you're farther away from it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 still hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sharpshooter!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That one's seven points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That pot shatters.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to be all right, Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's cool. There's actually one wisp actually next to somebody. Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Whoops!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was also the only wisp that wasn't affected by the Turn Undead. Where did that confetti come from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was left over from your welcome party.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I missed your welcome party.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha, it's your turn.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay! I'm going to attack him again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Carve this turkey.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes! 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits; roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you going to do your thing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All the stuffs?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All the stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rage! Reckless! Endangerment! Diviney!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a good name for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. As you swing past with the sword and arc upward, you cut through and its cloak cannot hold back together. There's now this giant opening where this vacuous, cold heartbeat glows, visible from the inside, and its body is flickering, having a hard time keeping itself together on this side of reality. Does this end your turn, Yasha?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. The little interior bit, what is it again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see this dull, blue glow that's now visible from where you struck through it. It looks like it's falling apart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shouting) Steal his heart! Take his heart!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha, that ends your turn?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I punch it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, no. You've already used your action. That's what a monk does. Just a little flick--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends Yasha's turn. Now the one wisp that's by you is going to shift through the wall onto this side and is going to make a strike at you, Fjord. That is a 16 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is 12 points of lightning damage to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whoa, that was a big one. Shit, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it shocks through you, and you fall to one knee for a moment. It's going to shift into that pillar and vanish. You do get an attack of opportunity on it as it leaves your range.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Disadvantage, or regular?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Regular.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 does not hit. You go to strike, and unfortunately it just makes it into the pillar and you hit stone and sparks off of it. It does take one point of force damage from spending its turn inside the wall. Now it is the entity's turn. It is going to attempt-- we'll see if its Howling Babble returns. It gets its Howling Babble back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're all right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, man, I forgot that. I need all of you to roll a wisdom saving throw, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does that affect his wisdom ability checks? The Hex?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ow, five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 11. Is his regeneration an ability check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, there's no check for it. Beau, Nott--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, don't you have to make a wisdom saving throw against my Sanctuary? Because you did a harmful spell against me, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me look at the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack must first make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not technically targeting the creature, you're just in the radius of what's happening.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "The spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately. What'd you roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't roll anything yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, now you get to roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled a four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I was trying to see it as a positive thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First off, all of you guys who failed your saving throw: Beau, Yasha, Jester, and Nott, you all suffer 14 points of psychic damage and you are stunned until the end of your next turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That thing is a bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester's unconscious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got one more with your name on it, sweet cheeks.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Three hit points, guys. I've got three hit points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to attempt to slip into the floor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I get an attack of opportunity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You and Caleb both get an attack of opportunity,

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're stunned.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it begins to shift into the ground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits; that's 20. That's five points of normal damage and five points of radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you want to do this? (cheering)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to swing and pin the heart to the ground and leave the blade there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, you see a dull blue glow where the sword is grinding against the stone, before that eventually dissipates into nothingness.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, ghostslayer!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Last pot!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Good job, Molly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, your stun wears off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That guy knew way too much about everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I see that last pot from where I am?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, that is a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13? Glancing about in the area, with torchlight from Yasha, you can see one visible pot that has not been shattered in that cage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, I will send a little Firebolt off and try to strike it. It's at disadvantage, correct? Okay, that's very bad. Also very bad. That's a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A ten just barely misses. You attempt to strike through, and it smashes against the wrought iron gate on the outside and disperses against it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can get right up to it if you want to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I should have done that first,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Jester and Molly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm unconscious.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run over to you and put a healing--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't waste a healing potion on me!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What else are we going to do? We can't heal!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't say anything. You're unconscious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You hush your mouth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have healing packs in my bag!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a healing potion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have doughnuts.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So take six points of heal, you're stabilized.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasping) Molly!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Back up, come on!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a bad day, you guys. Today is really hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester's now conscious.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I also, definitely lost my two swords now, so those are off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lost them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The swords are not glowing anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You stopped their effect?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had to feed a healing potion. I had two going, so I needed hands.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Jester's turn, as you come to consciousness, since you guys are on the same initiative.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can do something, if you like. Pot! Pot!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess I'll walk over and try to take out the pot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's half your movement to get up, and then five, ten, 15, that's as far as you get.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I try to throw something at it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you have to throw?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I don't think I have anything that will fit through that little hole-- I could try picking up a rock on the ground and throwing it at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make an investigation check to try and find a rock on the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I probably don't see one. If I did, it would take a whole lot of time!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you took your action searching the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Three!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not find a rock. You spend the better part of six seconds going, "Wait! Ah, no it's a piece of black cloth, shit!" No actual stone, unfortunately. Sorry, Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll spin around and try and Eldritch Blast that last pot in the other cage. At disadvantage. That's a 19!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits! Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just woke up, you guys!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's 11 points of damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 points of damage, nice! With that, that pot shatters, and you see this flicker in the stone column behind as the energy of the wisp flares out from the side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, Yasha, you guys doing anything?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm still stunned?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your stun now wears off. As you guys finish shaking off the energy, this cold energy begins to emerge from the far wall, through the bookcase.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! He's back? Okay, we run away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The same entity comes through the bookcase, like it's emerging from something behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grab his heart and run. From the ground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was no heart on the ground

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you struck it, the energy dispersed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's run away.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What if we have to get it with the sword?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a two-handed weapon. I can't do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yasha can, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why? You're strong! You can do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't use two-handed weapons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys watch it push out of the wall, (gasping sound) making its way there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait! Maybe if we show it the sword, he'll chill out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, make an intelligence check. You make a religion check with advantage, because you have undead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a straight intelligence?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Straight intelligence modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After reading through the notes and going through the book, you recall that a lot of the magic in here entails binding the soul to the remains of the physical form, as you've seen with all of the wisps. It is a similar return of the entity you just fought.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, his body's somewhere!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where's that corkscrew thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On its turn, it's going to attempt-- first, let's see if it gets its Howling Babble back. It does not; it's a one. So it's going to try Whispers of Madness again. I need only Yasha and Beau, actually. Everyone else is spread out. Yasha and Beau, I need you both to make a wisdom saving throw as the whispers now begin to emanate from its mouth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's coming from the bookcase.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's better, 16?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? Okay, Yasha?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven, so Beau--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, we have the book that we found in the research center.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, you resist the whispers and close your eyes, and as you come up to try to make this point, next thing you see is Yasha looking at you and (swoosh) down with your sword. Make an attack against Beau.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I see this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to quickly cast before this goes-- I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no, you got it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to cast one level--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your vision, as this happens, all of a sudden goes black. You watch as this dark blood pools at the corners of Yasha's face, as you go blind from his blood maledict. So roll with disadvantage on the attack.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah! Disadvantage would mean it was--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lowest one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The lowest number, okay. I didn't know if it-- okay, three. Oh, sorry, five. Six!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see it just in time and bat it out of the way. It hits the stone next to you. You do suffer 11 points of psychic damage, however.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm unconscious?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as she swings at you, and the impact, as you parry it, Yasha goes down with the blade swing, onto the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you just kill her?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I do have, hold on-- I thought I had something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's an ability you get at later levels that does something in this scenario.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's not now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't think you have something for that right now. I could be wrong.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm unconscious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll double check just to be safe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The book said the soul is bound to the flesh be it in any form, ice or ash, but the ash in the pots was the will-o'-wisp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It says, "From ashes I shall rise again."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe there's something behind the bookcase?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go look!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's actually a good roll, six force damage to it. You have the divine energy, path zealot, and your soul is marked for battle-- the only ability you have now is the warrior of the gods. You don't have the other one yet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes its turn. Beau, you're up. You watch Yasha slam on the ground, unconscious next to you, the blade clattering to the ground and coming to rest. The creature lifts up (wheezing) and vanishes into the stone above you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't get a reaction from it, as it goes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was not close enough to you, unfortunately.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck. I'm going to run over to this bookcase and put my staff behind it to see if I can knock it over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the staff on the fulcrum. Go ahead and make an athletics check to force it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on! (singing) Get it, girl. Get it, get it, girl.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck! That keeps happening! Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You try and (grunt) and it's starting to rock, but it's heavy. You start pushing. You can't quite get the bookcase to come over, unfortunately. That ends your turn?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am going to start moving towards the middle, towards Yasha. I don't have any healer's kit or anything. I don't know how to do anything like that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's okay. Get the bookcase.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to die!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I hold a Fire Bolt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can hold it as an action. You're casting the spell. Then whenever something triggers it, you release it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, when it appears.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's immune to fire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't know that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seemed to take damage, though lesser, when you hit it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Resistant

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you catch fire to the bookcase?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't want to burn the room around us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester, Molly?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I try to heal Yasha, or move the bookcase? I'm the strong one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Move the bookcase.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I set it on fire, someone will still have to pull it anyway. It's not like it's going to disintegrate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can use my last spell. I have a 2nd-level spell. I'm going to, bonus action, use Healing Word at 2nd-level on Yasha to bring her back, and then I'm going to run over and try to crash the bookcase down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for that. 2d4 plus your Wisdom modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Six plus four. Ten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You heal ten hit points. Yasha, you come to consciousness on the ground. Your weapon is about two feet from your grasp. The first thing you do, your eyes shoot open and then shoot to your weapon. Natural instinct to defend yourself. It's easily within your grasp. You just have to get up to grab it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I get all the way over to the bookcase?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (counting) 30. You get right to the bookcase.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I try to yank it over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I give her some assistance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be your action to do so; you've already tried. The DC is going down as you both are working on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you grab and reach around the side with Beau, you pull on the bookcase. (creaking) You step back quickly as it slams onto the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there anything behind it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right behind it there's a small pocket where the stone seems to have crumbled a bit. It looks like a dark space on the inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How small?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about that wide on the wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's in there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet its remains are in there! Kill it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, does that end your turn, Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think I can do anything else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's all you've got. Molly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run over to it and start taking slices at it. I'm going to stab it with my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have darkvision, so as both you and Jester glance inside, you can see there is a small five foot by five foot chamber inside, where there are a number of pots and small cases. It was a small burial chamber of some kind. There in the center, you see this large urn, about a foot and a half wide, squat, a dull gray color. You have no color depth in this darkness, unfortunately, with your darkvision, but it's this very squat, well-made vase or urn of some kind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mm-hmm. Two shots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're having to put your arm through and swing towards it, so disadvantage on each strike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. First one is 13 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see how much damage you deal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's eight points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of damage. You make impact, and you see a part of it crack from the blow, but it's not enough to shatter it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm taking another swing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull it out and jam the other arm in to go for a straight strike with your scimitar.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 17 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's five points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you reach through, you feel the urn break beneath the blow. There's this moment of silence as you hear this (low gasp) dully filter out. The entity slowly shifts from the ceiling as you watch it disintegrate. Not vanishing like it did before, but slowly dissipating. Its form suddenly goes from extremely menacing to almost sad, as you watch it turn to nothingness.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Poofs out into a doughnut as a Fire Bolt goes (fwoosh)! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Smoke grenade! That's awesome!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mushroom cloud, that was great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like Rick Moranis in Ghostbusters 2.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there any way to get in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't fit through the hole, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to go in there, look for things, and break every damn--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait! We should heal, you guys. Should we take a short rest and heal up a little bit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should take a short rest. A breather, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Jester, thank you for healing me. I feel like I did not deserve that, but thank you very much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! You're welcome. You deserved it so much! You did so good!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy, I've already used most of my hit dice. That's crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys take a short rest of about an hour or so, as you sit down and recover your breath, take a moment to center yourself, tend to your wounds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: After we've rested for a while, can I walk over to the little hole and peek in? I can't fit through that little hole, can I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're pretty tiny. Make an acrobatics check. This is one of the benefits of being something so small.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten? You just manage to pull through. It wasn't a hard--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take off my stuff, give it to Caleb for safekeeping, and do you have any butter or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's see. Let me look in my possessions. I don't think I have any butter.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't want to get wet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got a little bit of oil.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah! Oil! I'll take some oil!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I use all my hit dice when I heal, because of Tough, right? There was something I got.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, I'm asking Beau to slather me in oil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grease the goblin action is what you're taking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get it in there! Work it in! Mm-hmm!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not for Tough, it gives you additional hit points. There's another feat that does that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like I got that, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got Tough for the additional hit points.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was there something else that does that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Durable is the one feat that gives you +1 Constitution when you roll hit dice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like there was a thing. I'll have to keep reading.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll give you a little bit of a therapeutic temple rub while I'm at it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to Slip N' Slide my way into the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (screaming)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The worst! It's the worst!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got ashed and feathered? Tarred and-- What do you call it? Oiled and ashed!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's cool guys. It's fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Suddenly I'm scared of falling on the beach.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I send in two globules after her to see the antiqued goblin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a small chamber. It's five foot by five foot. Anyone else is going to be pretty down in there, but you fit in fairly comfortably. There's the shattered urn and a few small pieces of pottery with intricate gold scrolling. They're probably very nice pieces of art or decor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to check for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Uh-huh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is that? 600? 700?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you counting, Ash?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am, but I might have lost count.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It takes the edge off.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, it does.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've never seen so many people happy for a natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As best you can tell, the room seems safe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. You said there's a few urns that are fancier than the others?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two large ones, nowhere near as big as the central urn that's been shattered, but there's two in the corner and a few small boxes off to the side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's in the urns?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over the inside, and they are empty. They look to be pieces of art that may have meant something to the person who previously--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will they fit through the hole?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may have to dig the hole open a little bit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can dig it open a little bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you can.

lines.name: ASHLEY, TRAVIS
lines.text: (slamming)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Given a little time, Yasha begins to peel the stones from the wall around it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those boxes, can I check in those?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, which one? There's one on each side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take the right one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you take the right one. You lift the lid, and as you do, you pull it open and powder emerges into your face. Make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Constitution save? That would be a four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four? Okay! You take nine points of poison damage, and you're poisoned for the next hour.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This cloud enters your lungs and you begin coughing. It burns the inside of your throat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey Nott, how's it going in there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great! It's fine! I'm going to cast Mage Hand and open the other one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go. (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a five feet by five?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's five by five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're in a tiny-- Why don't you bring that thing out of there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! I've got this! I'm fine! I'll find the treasure! There's nothing else in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, there's nothing else. You look down into the box. There are sets of gold and silver rings and jewelry. It looks like whatever jewelry once may have been dressed upon the individual who was interred in that urn that was scattered. This is where their jewelry was placed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to take all of those things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bring the art out, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, as soon as the hole gets bigger. I'll open the other box with my Mage-y Hand-y!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That box opens up, and there's another splash of that same poisonous powder, but you're off to the side. It only gets anyone who's immediately in front of the box.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did it, guys!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel like Nott's head comes out of the hole, going (rapid gasping) for fresh air.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's in that box?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That box contains a folded raiment of some kind, like a ceremonial mantle made of dark black and gray cloth with red embroidered designs on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I recognize any symbols or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yay! That's seven!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are knocking it out of the park for charity!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're like, "We didn't anticipate this."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone, I found a piece of clothing, an article of (hacking cough) clothing! Here, I'll pass it out to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it pretty?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's very pretty. Some art pieces. Some

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rich people love fancy art.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look at the art? Do I know the artists?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the giant boxes, you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know what's going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The art are two large, well-made vases, that you eventually pull through the space here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's not as cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't recognize it. These were made a long time ago.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, they're antique.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could be worth a pretty penny.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about that cloak?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I put them in the bag. How about that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You have the folded mantle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does the mantle look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mantle is a dark black, a front chest mantle area, with gray stripes coming along the sides and this red embroidered design that emerges from around the neck, all across the front and back of the mantle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it look familiar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was hoping.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I come up and see if it has any magic feel to it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you can make an arcana check to see if you recognize any elements of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am stowing away the journal in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a fold at the front of it, a small pocket right there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's got a little compartment in the front.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like a kangaroo pouch?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of, it's on the side. Because a mantle would go down to about there for someone wearing it. you put your hand in there, and it's a heavy material.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to try it on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would prefer to inspect it. Are we going to stay here for a little while?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While all of this is going on, Beau wants to be going through some of these books that were on the shelf that we knocked over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The shelf is mostly empty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There was that one book on the desk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could sit down on the floor together and have a look.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What else did you get out of there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have the urns in the cages. You have the tables over there. You have the two braziers filled with ash on the sides. You have the broken cages back there. Everything that you see there is what's in the chamber.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to do a tour of the urns and see if there's anything, jewelry or something, hidden in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, what I would recommend, if we feel comfortable sitting down for a moment, is to put all of our findings in the middle of the room, and I can ritually see which of these things are magic. Most of these things, we suspect, but maybe there are some other things. Then I can tell what exactly they are. I need some time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is a good idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, before Nott even got out, I'm stowing the journal away for a closer read.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Totally fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The urns are scattered ash. Nothing catches your eye from those two. The nooses you pull through and tug on, and the rope rots and breaks in your grasp. You go past the brazier on that side with the ashes, and you poke around with your staff, and something catches your staff underneath the ash. You prod in there, and as you push it aside, there's an object in the ash that is partially burned. As you pull it free and dust it off, it's another book. A large portion of the back of it is burned off, and most of the pages are destroyed on the back end, but a good half of the book is mostly still intact. Like when it got thrown in there to be destroyed, the flame wasn't quite strong enough to consume the entire book.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a little flip through of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. As you go through, it's filled with strange script and scrolling. Make an arcana check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. You don't understand the nature of any of this, but it seems magical in nature. The script and elements of design remind you of the things you saw on the ceiling in the previous room. Though not exact, there are similarities to the way the script is drawn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You start bashing and shaking it. You bend and eventually tear through some of the cage and glance through. You guys, together, begin to inspect the other cages, and honestly, in there, what you find is ash. Most everything in this chamber has been destroyed. Intentionally, it seems. Either by the previous denizen, who lived here, that you destroyed, or somebody else that had been here in here before. The only things that you find are what was in that burial chamber in the back, and that mostly burned tome in your hand.

lines.text: But a

lines.text: With the scrolling and runes on the edge. The blade itself is this wide, thick, gradually coming to a point, greatsword, about five feet long from hilt to edge of blade. It's practically an anime sword. Looking at it, and based on what he discovered of the sword itself, it was used in the Age of Arcanum as an executioner's blade, to kill mages that were caught by the law and went against the law of the land. It was used, and probably had been used, to execute a number of mages in the past.

You get the sense that the final moments in this chamber were probably very paranoid.
