lines.text: Walk up. Double tap, followed by a single.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A moment passes, and the door (lock clicks, creak). Dolan's head peeks out. "Gentlemen, it's good to see you. What news have you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only a moment of your time. I'm a little embarrassed that I did not remember this the other day, but it was quite an evening that night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When Ulog was in that house, he found something that I think you should have. Shortly before he expired, he shoved it into my hand. I pull out those papers that he found about the wife. It's a little frayed, he shoved it into my hand. We are lucky that it did not burn up, but take this, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. I'll see what I can do. Things are a bit tense right now, of course."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When it makes sense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. How is Horris?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Safe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On his way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, thank god."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To Berleben.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To Berleben? That's far enough away, I think, from any influence here. Thank you. Thank you so much."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course. It was the least we can do. We trust with this information and the right things occurring in the next few days, you can find your way to some prosperous moves for this city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I hope so."

lines.name: LAIM
lines.text: A lot of bad things are happening now. It would be nice if one good thing could come of it all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is right in this city. There are good people. As terrible as the death of the High-Richter may be, in essence I think much good may come out of it, in the long run."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's entirely up to you now, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you for the update, thank you for Horris, and good luck, friends. I do hope we meet again soon, in better times."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tschüß.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Closes the door, locks it behind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Broken clock twice a day. Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you guys heading back to The Leaky Tap?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you head back to The Leaky Tap, people are starting to come to consciousness and exit the building. The street becomes a little more bustling. One of the barkers, one of the town criers that you had seen before when you arrived begins coming down the street, and begins doing his shouts. "Harvest Close comes on the third of Fessuran! Harvest Close comes on the third of Fessuran!" and continues walking past.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We could enter in a contest and fight for the Harvest Festival, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, there was something about that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really? Just for sport?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Maybe there's prize money or something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That could be a nice change of pace.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like fighting people for fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get closer to The Leaky Tap and see another female--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, in the Victory Pit!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another town crier comes by, younger female, with the big tabard and the scroll as she walks by says, "Conflict at the Xhorhasian border grows violent! Watch your children at night!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Hide your kids! Hide your wife!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Conflict at the Xhorhasian border grows violent! Watch your children at night!" She continues walking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happened to the children?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks back at you, "I'm just reading the paper."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: May I have one of those?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No--"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to look at it, and then I'm going to give it back to you. Does it say any more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On this, it has the Xhorhasian note, and it has the Harvest Close coming the third of Fessuran. Those are the two notes of the day.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You literally just-- that's all that's on there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's my job."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where do we sign up for the Victory Pit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell me. You know!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to tell her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intimidation check. Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We had a long-ass night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With advantage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Marisha, your theme with children continues.

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: She is not a child!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What am I doing, intimidation? 14. She is not a child.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (Stammering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's a rec center, community service--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, at the Victory Pit. It's in the Pentamarket, probably. I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She takes the paper from Yasha and darts off down the street.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's not a verbal learner.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I liked her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could tell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I start yelling out: The third of the Fessuran is the end of the harvest!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we know what day it is today?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hide your kids! Hide your wife!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The third of Fessuran is about five days away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a Victory Pit!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Passion Pit on the third of Fessuran!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys return to The Leaky Tap and we'll say for the time being, we're going to have a few days of downtime. If there's anything specifically you want to do, that's not story-centric.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I need money! He said out of character.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sell shit. Sign up for the Victory Pit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What are you selling?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a lot of rings. I should see if I can get any good money for some of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pawn the rings that we have.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Unless there's an opal in there, I'm getting rid of the ring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None of the rings have gems. They're all base metals, like gold and silver.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have some fancier rings, though, from before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to try and hock some, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That were stolen from your boss?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's fine. They're probably fake, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything you took from the circus was not real.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wasn't The Gentleman supposed to reward us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was trade.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Us not getting charged for murder was the reward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: While they're figuring it out, on one of the days can I make my way by Ren Sutan's physician's office?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do that. What do you want to do at Ren's?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to casually look on the outside, see if it's still in business, see if it's still bustling, or if anything has come their way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You spend a little bit of time watching. It's still a functional physician's practice. People still need a physician. You can't tell from a distance if it's darkened by the arrest of Lord Sutan, but you can't imagine it's gone well within the family house. It's still a functional facility. It's still one of the finer places to go for medical purposes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use my Mask of Many Faces, and I'll adopt an older face with a gray beard and a dark hood, and can I walk into the physician's office?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, easily enough. You walk into the main area, and one of the clerks there with the same white robes approaches. "Can I help you, sir?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Commit to it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (as Sean Connery) Is Ren Sutan there? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What do you require of the Doctor?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (as Sean Connery) Just get him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "I'm sorry to bother you there, sir, but he's not in at the moment, but we have a few of the clerks that could help you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (Sean Connery voice peters out) You don't want his trouble with the Myriad to spill over to you, do you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His eyes go wide. "We have no business--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fetch him. Now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happened to Sean Connery?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I fucking lost it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (as Sean Connery) Fetch him now. I'm a Russian sub commander.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. I'll go fetch him." He walks past you out of the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (as Sean Connery) Do your best. Losers always whine about their best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He walks around you and exits the front of the facility and begins walking down the road, out of sight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll turn and follow him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Sean Connery) I cast Hexblade.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Bee-lining straight to the nearest crownsguard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will turn on my heel and use my Mask of Many Faces to turn into a lovely woman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A moment later, two crownsguard come rushing, blades drawn, behind the clerk, who's pointing towards the front of the building, and they rush past you in the interior and begin to look around. They both split on the inside and begin going through the different rooms. It seems not only did he not believe you, but dropping the name of the Myriad in a public space like that, that's immediate call to the guard for these guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I make my way back to The Leaky Tap.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow, that's good to know!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to scout out the Hearth of the Allhammer, the Raven's Den in the graveyard, and the Platinum House, and see if there's a lot of guards, or if there's any of those that don't have a lot of guards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the most part, the places of worship, they're not very prominent. They're not huge temples. They're kept here out of law that was decided upon, but they're nice. They usually have a handful of crownsguard stationed to each, but it's not like they're under intense watch. There aren't a lot of worshipers during certain times of the day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there any one that seems emptier than other ones?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of all of them, I would say it would be the Raven's Den, which is at the Ossuary Gates, which is the large, vast graveyard of most of the higher-ranked families of this city. The Matron of Ravens' temple is the one that's least attended, largely because, dealing with death, it's not as bright and welcoming to the common folk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could I try to get in there when nobody's in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the base of it, you can see a number of bowls and offerings that have been left around from people that have come and passed through. Beyond that, there is a door to the small shrine behind it, it's this small structure. Maybe 20 feet by ten feet. It's not a very large shrine. You've seen groups of people that function as morticians, in long dark robes and dark clothing, that have entered and exited this facility. You wait for a while, as there is one body that's being interred at a family plot, and then as they all begin to scatter, you see a few other leave, and at that moment, the interior, from what you can tell, is empty, or at least you've watched three individuals leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I get in my disguise kit and affix a mustache onto her porcelain mask, and put a wig on her, and then write across the bottom of it "The Traveler was here," and leave a pamphlet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to see as much as I can do in that amount of time before anybody comes back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sleight of hand for the mustache.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. Off to a good start. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you leap up onto the statue, and go to affix the mustache to it, a voice over by the shrine says, "Excuse me? Excuse me!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh hello, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see a pale young man, short blonde hair, emerge with a similar dark robe that you didn't see in the inside of the shrine. He goes "Could you please-- you're not allowed to climb the statue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was a smudge on her face, and I know that the people get really pissed when there's stuff on their statues. I was trying to clean it off for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate that-- Well, thank you. It's just-- considered--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rub my arm across it to try and clean it off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you so much."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I got it though! Don't worry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate that."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please do. Please I can pray with you if you'd like."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that'd be great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He sits down next to you and you both silently sit there, on your knees, and begin to pray quietly up to the Queen. You watch as one raven looks down over you both. Soon as he looks up and finishes his prayer, he extends his hand for a moment and it takes off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that always happen when you pray to this lady?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not often, but perhaps she smiles upon you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She does. I know she does because she likes me so much because I worship her real good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Well, have a good day." He gets up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, the rest of the funeral procession is now returning to the shrine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit. Damn it! Is there anything to tuck a pamphlet into?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, you can tuck it under any of the various offering bowls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll do that at least.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's literally a cadaver that just went into the building. Not to give you ideas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you know, perhaps another time you can come by and try it again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I'm going to try some other time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you wish to do over the next few days?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to try some chemical altered states.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's time to have a good night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait is this with the shrooms?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just you alone?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what night are you doing this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably the celebratory first night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What time are you starting?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, just before dusk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll join you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is the nature of the goods that you have?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have no idea.

lines.name: MATT, SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Skein.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we bought those magic mushrooms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's a fungal powder.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey Caleb, you want to take a look at the pouch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Skein, I've heard many arguments over the pronunciation.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a real thing? You didn't make it up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the word is a real thing. It's a weaving term.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I take a look at this skein, can I take a guess at what kind of illicit material I'm looking at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a fungus. Make a medicine check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I have bad experience with fungus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can do a medicine check. Do you want me to look at it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Medicine you say? That is a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks to be a fungus of some sort with a property to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I don't have good association with that. You take that back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's only enough for two other people to take it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I have mine. Then you bought some too, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm holding it in my fucking hand. Don't you see it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, how much is that?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, you guys go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not going to take it. I was letting you know I'm bought it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh well here. I always partake what--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean we could poison somebody later. That would be fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, it's a little late, because I already took mine. I'm waiting to see what's happening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. When Beau hears that she goes--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two of them have taken it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoever's sober, keep us out of trouble.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yasha!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You guys get started and I'll--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) Oh no, Yasha you always do this, no! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Somehow she knows you, you always do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bullshit!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) Where do you go, Yasha?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of you that have ingested the skein-- Ten minutes pass, and the edges of your vision begin to cloud, and as you sit for a moment your body begins to feel a bit weird. Nausea creeps in a bit. Then, a very faint snow of dust in your vicinity begins to coat. You know the Upside Down? Where there's that weird material floating around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like Legend?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little bit. Only for about ten feet out to you. It's a ten foot area around you, and the coloration of your vision in this area becomes a gray, colorless, black, white, and gray tone. I need you both to make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) This sucks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look at the stuff?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A wisdom saving throw? 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to say: Don't fuck me Gil! Oh, okay. Just a wisdom saving throw? 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a very dangerous substance. For the duration, the two of you can see into the Ethereal Plane out to ten feet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going walking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who wants to go to a cemetery right now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait it takes them to the Ethereal Plane?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They can see into the Ethereal Plane out to a range of ten feet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to put on my least interesting cloak, and I'm going to go find myself a cemetery.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I flip my blue cloak inside out to the brown side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know where they're going, but I think we got to babysit them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (distorted) How do you guys feel?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How do you feel? Do you see anything? Is it interesting?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it sucks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to work on it though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you guys going on a

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not quite like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can see really cool things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this happens, this translucent piranha-faced serpent scoots by, this ghastly looking angler fish creature like-- (gasping breathing).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Hey Steve."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going for a walk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Molly, how long does this last?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have no idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck. This is it. This is the rest of our lives.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we saying this is night one, of a couple of days of piddling around?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought that this was the first night, and this was our celebratory night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, this is more of a downtime period, so I'm trying to get through events.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm grabbing a little drink downstairs, and then I'm going to go walk in whatever direction seems the most interesting shit outside is in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I join Molly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm babysitting them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to follow behind and throw pebbles at them from behind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the best interest of keeping a low profile for the next few days, you both wander out into the city streets, altered on--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In our hoods and our boring cloaks!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of the hour I need both of you to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Glad I got another pouch of this stuff, could come in handy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This could come in handy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just a saving throw?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your body is pretty strained by the process.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Drink and a bathhouse?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got such cottonmouth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know what just occurred to me? I didn't have a childhood. I've never said that out loud to someone before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mmm. What happens if you have a childhood, but it's barely a childhood because it was supposed to be someone else's childhood, but it was you instead? Is that a childhood?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What happened to you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're following behind you guys right here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's get you to a bathhouse. You were eating dirt about ten minutes ago. Said it was snow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that why I have cotton mouth? Ah goddamn it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you got a big mud goatee.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so proud of you. You did so well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I saw this goatman and he told me just don't eat the yellow snow and you'd be okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the essence, being one who's in tune with your body, and you as well, that this is definitely not a safe substance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is definitely not a safe substance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It may have, with the right scenario, some situationally beneficial properties.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I still have half a dose. I think it would be real funny to plant it on somebody and get them busted later.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was it a powder, or was it like crumbles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a crumbled, dry, almost a spongy--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You guys looked like idiots, just so you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shall we get you cleaned up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to get Nott cleaned up, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott cleaned up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah Nott's covered in ash.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah, everybody, let's take a bath.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I have tried to find any information on the conflict on the Xhorhas border?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why you so interested, huh?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I have shit to do as well, party animals.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't judge me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I judge you heavily.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's how I talk to people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shouting) "Tell me what you know!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (deep voice) Hey! Conflict! Xhorhas?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't glean a lot of details. Most folks tend to steer clear and walk to the other side of the road when they see you coming. What you do get to hear is that-- Amongst the Ashkeeper Peaks, the mountains that largely border the south and eastern side of The Empire, to the north, there is that break. That's where the Ashguard Garrison is and the Rockguard Garrison. That's where most of the battle takes place. That's the protection border that The Empire holds to keep the Xhorhasian hordes and creatures from the waste to wander in. Although many still filter through the mountains and such. Apparently there's been rising conflict out there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: To the north?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Assaults on the garrisons, yeah. Northeast of where you are. Further east more, east, little bit north. You have a map. You can look. You guys bought a map.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, you want to see this map? You're not with me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is an entire three day weekend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, this is throughout a week so if you wanted to pull the map out--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pull it out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know where you guys put the map. You have a physical map.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, whip it out and shove it in his hand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's over there somewhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go get it. Or somebody other than the pregnant woman go get it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. Not as fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Blood flow, she's fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, she's got to walk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's pregnant. She's not dead!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's been assaults on the garrison. It seems similar to what you heard wandering through the street before, there have been more whispers of children being stolen in the night from homesteads close to the border.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Hide yo kids.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) Hide yo wives.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I found the map, you guys! I had it somewhere safe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the east, you can see the garrisons, and the gap that leads to the Xhorhasian side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the Xhorhas side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah, look at that. I don't think I've ever been there before.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's the Ashkeep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, the Brokenveil Bluffs look scary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you guys want to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will gladly give you money, but first-- I'm going to cast Disguise Self, and turn myself into looking just like a normal halfling little girl and spend an hour at a cafe just having lunch and being a normal person.

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then after that, I'm going to go, and is there any place if I investigate for a while, is there any place, or service, or person, or anything that can send a package long distance safely? Money being no object.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few facilities in which there is a parcel system that travels between the larger cities and can go to outskirt cities, but those are a little more expensive. Yeah, that does exist.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much to get a package to Felderwin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To Felderwin? How big a package? For a week's worth of travel, it'll cost you about five gold, not too much.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five gold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a fairly upper end system to send a package.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pretty good, actually. That's cheap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For you guys, yeah, for the average person, it's not cheap.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten games ago, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll pay for rush delivery.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no rush delivery. They can only go by the speed of horse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll get insurance!

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM
lines.text: Certified.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tracking number included.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, thank you. I'll write a note, and I'll put in various items.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A bunch of buttons, all the rings, door knob, brass baby bottle, all the ball bearings, and the two bracelets.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. I think I know where you're sending it, so. All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And some money.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 50 gold. You assemble this package, wrap it up, I imagine disguise yourself once more. Paying five gold for delivery, the parcel is sent and on its way to Felderwin. All righty, anybody else?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, a couple of things, so I need more ink and paper, the kind to transcribe spells. Before I get to that, and before they go off on their drug party. Yes, before Jester goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not a party.

lines.name: MARISHA, MATT
lines.text: Bad idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It has only been a short amount of time that I am thinking, and I will be very careful, with the bag.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you coming onto me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was going to ask if I could hold the Haversack and its contents for a day, so that I could better inspect and understand the thing that--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why do you have to do that? It's pink! It's mine! I paid for it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I understand that. I don't want to keep the bag. I want to have it before you go off to do, I don't know, maybe you're going on a tour or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not going to do anything. Do you want to hang out with me, and then you can look in the bag with me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Aren't you about to go out with them? You told me you were leaving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, all right, I would love to inspect our special

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a lot of people that inspect their special packages. You get to know yourself

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know you are going to drag me over the coals for this request, and that is fine. I would like the dungeon master to fast forward to the part where you tell me if you will allow me to inspect the contents of this Haversack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. You want to look at it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to do this together?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll hang out with you. I really want to see it, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On a different night, maybe tomorrow night, because you just told me you were about to go out with Molly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then maybe I'll keep it now, and then I'll come back tomorrow night and we'll do this again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just inspect what's in the bag.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then I find Nott.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll go see you again tomorrow. I come back. Hey, okay, do you want to check this out now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What, are you back already? No, wait a second! I'm talking to Nott, in this part of the day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we'll come back. You find Nott.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm really blushing. How much disposable income do you have at the moment?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Disposable? I have 285 gold, and therefore, disposable: 280.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you possibly loan me 200 gold?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here's 280 gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) You need 50 still to send in your package.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Already done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! How much money did you have?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think I need that much.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give me the change when you're done spending.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will give you the change. Thank you, friend. I will pay you back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fine. Or not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you for teaching me how to-- and I pull out the wire and back up 20 feet across the room. Whisper: teaching me this spell. You can reply to this message.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! You're welcome, young padawan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know the thing about it for us is, we can go--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have to cast it again!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, we can go back and forth over and over again, just you and me. It's endless.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you're right! It's forever. It's a little muffled.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For the other

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is really good. I can also hear you across the room though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know. I understand, but for demonstration purposes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good job. Over and out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the sound the door makes when you enter Pumat's store!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Where are you going?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To Pumat's to buy ink and paper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough to do. "You go ahead and purchase enough materials as you need to get your spells there transcribed. Good on you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. I buy 200 gold worth and I bring Nott the 85 gold change.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure enough.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: May I sell my other sword?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You may. It's not going to fetch you too much because it's seen a lot of use. "

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I sharpen it. It's so sharp. I sharpen it every night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's wonderful. I think in the long run, that'll be a very useful feature, but it's also not that uncommon of an object-- "

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's touched by the moon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll happily give you 30 gold pieces for that there sword, if you don't mind?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I paid all of my money for this, and it was so much more than that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your persuasion pity roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All of your money?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. It actually was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll take it off your hands for 40."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. We'll find a good home for it. I trust you on that."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Thank you, Pumat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No problem."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispers) Always remember your first one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (whispers) It wasn't my first sword.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispers) Well, shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is my flask done?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your flask is done.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A Flask of Endless Alcohol.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. That's not an item on DnD Beyond.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll be waiting for you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll wake up in the morning, early after my drug hangover, and make my way, quietly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Quite a headache.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Quite a headache! Coffee, the bacon that I had in my pocket from yesterday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pocket bacon! It's the best kind!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I head to the Cobalt Reserve.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cobalt Soul. Cobalt Reserve is on Tal'Dorei.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, the Cobalt Soul branch in Zadash.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. You head to the Archive. What would you like to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll see if I can find Dairon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You ask around for a bit. Some of the various monks recognize you on entry, and they greet you with an acknowledging nod. You didn't make a lot of friends while you were here, of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sup?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, you do come across Archivist Xenoth who, as you're asking the question, one of the monks sends you over to Xenoth. He goes, "Oh, Beauregard. It's good to see you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How may we help you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Dairon in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can go and inquire. Are you here for more training?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just find Dairon. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm proud of-- "

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just go find Dairon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she steps down, her elvish features smiling, her eyes taking acknowledgement of your presence, approaches you. "You have called for me."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Talk in private?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. This way," and Dairon walks past. Xenoth goes, "It was good to see you, Beauregard!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bye, Xenoth!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dairon leads you to one of the meeting chambers, which is usually used for research and individuals that want to quietly read through books or take notes. Dairon closes the door behind, and it's just the two of you. "So what are the honors?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just want to let you know I'm in town and busy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. I've heard. You are making a small name for yourself with your friends."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that good or bad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know, is it?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. It's hard to read you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. I've worked hard to not be easy to read. I'll tell you one thing: being invisible can get you in some doors that otherwise you could not, but notoriety can get you in doors that you couldn't otherwise as well. Either path has its benefits; the choice is yours which to take."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't think the two could be mutually exclusive? Or best of both worlds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) "With enough training and discipline, maybe. Two things, unfortunately, you lack."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "In time, perhaps. So why are you here? Just to tell me you're in town?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that I'm back and I'm dedicated. I figured showing up would be good, you know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is good. I'm proud of you. Do you wish to train?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I always have time."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My kind of woman. Let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." Dairon leads you out of the chamber and down below the archive where, as you recall, is the subterranean training boxes for the monks in which you have sand pits, you have all sorts of assembled-- essentially-- the word escapes me-- A series of things you have to climb--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Obstacle course?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you! An obstacle course-- my brain is not working right now, at the moment. Obstacle courses, and places that are designed to help you gain more skill in advancing through urban and exterior vicinities. It looks like a parkour park a little bit, but not-- there in that space, you and Dairon spend the better part of the afternoon-- her essentially beating the shit out of you via these courses, showing you some better placement of your applications of Extract Aspects, hearing tales about the things you've encountered, and teaching you the importance of the specific bits of information that is most useful in the heat of battle-- advancing this training and giving you a little more focused idea of the path that you have been taking, and the path that you are going.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I tell her about the Xhorhasian spies and the terrorist that we encountered. Does she seem like she knew that knowledge or not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She knew that they had come through; she is caught off guard that you had actually encountered them directly. Dairon says, "Interesting. I will take this into my studies."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They said they were looking for an artifact. Something that the wizards here had stolen? Something that they said furthered their bloodline and made sure that they furthered their population. I don't know. Do you know anything about it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the first moment, you see a brief crack of emotion, and she leans in. "Whatever those things told you, do not trust it. Do not take it as anything but desire to conquer and kill."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why else would they attack the tower if they weren't looking for something specific?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I'm sure they were looking for something. Do not show pity for these things."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I never said I show pity. I wanted to know what the hell this artifact was that they were after. Figured you here at the Cobalt Soul would know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, the detailed business of the Cerberus Assembly is very carefully guarded and outside of our jurisdiction, but we're doing our best to keep an eye in case anything slips through the cracks. They do a lot of good, but I don't trust a mage that powerful."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We wouldn't have any records on some Xhorhasian artifact that apparently keeps them alive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "None that I've come across."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keep your ear out. If you encounter another one of these things-- these objects-- or at worse, another one of these Cricks, bring what it has, bring it to us."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Thank you, Dairon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. I may not be here in a month or so--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm going to travel to Bladegarden. See what I can gather on the front lines. With these conflicts escalating, I wish to be informed as to who's in charge there and perhaps what dangers might be creeping further into the empire."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This Bloodgarden in the northeast side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bladegarden is outside of where the garrisons are, yes. It's where most of the main military is held."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I still have a lot of training, so come back alive, I guess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway, one more round of sparring?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you and Dairon continue to trade blows and continue the lessons throughout the day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's awesome. I want to do that obstacle course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go back and join the rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else anyone wants to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Dodecahedron, next night!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I go knocking on his door the next night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I buy all that ink and paper and I spend the rest of that day learning a small handful of new spells, which are in the Rolodex now, and then the next night--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (rapidly knocking)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, hallo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (still knocking) Hello!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you coming in? Come in, it's open.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is night time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am definitely in the room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (seductively) Hello Caleb. Hello Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb and I have a date to talk about his special package.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need some privacy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we're good. I open up the haversack and pull out the box.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you curious yourself?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, you might need me to heal you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the best-- ooh, that's a good idea. You know, to the best of my knowledge, this is-- and it's limited-- this is a very powerful thing, and we are taking a risk--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: --but one that I think is worthwhile.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you still game?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (clenching) Yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's leave it in the lead box, but we'll lift the lid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's probably good, because people are still looking for it probably, so it's probably stupid that we're fucking with it right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is a calculated risk and we are going to do this. We are not going to take a lot of time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's nice that you guys are talking about your limitations and setting your expectations before you go into this together. There's some word that you need, like a safe-thing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, the safe word is Fjord, so if shit goes pear-shaped, and one of us says Fjord, get Fjord.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Are you going to go all like (tonal sound) while you look at it, or are you going to be normal?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Truthfully, I have no idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You game?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Totally game.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, I am not coming on to you, but will you hold my hand while we do this, that way if we-- (laughter) I cannot even look at you-- I cannot believe I am doing this experiment with you. Let's not cover the camera, and let's examine it together, and if we go to the Nine Hells or something, at least we'll be there together in theory.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are going to look at this thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you, or just you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. I am looking at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you focus on the strange artifact, concentrating on it, you feel your vision drawn towards it. Part of you feels like your body's leaning forward, like you're about to hit your forehead, but Caleb hasn't moved at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see shapes and forms of purples and blues, these amorphous clouds that drift by on a scale that you cannot comprehend. You see darkened spheres and objects passing you as you drift into nothing, into this void with distant dots of light and sparkle. You get to that point you were before, where you feel like there's a threshold, and your heart begins to race. Do you continue?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispers) Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got his hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue past that threshold, the speed begins to increase.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (excitedly) Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel the back of your neck begin to grow warm and the hair begin to stand up. While you cannot see, you can still sense your body's presence-- unmoving, but moving so quickly, this duel sensation is conflicting and causing your heart rate to jump. Your breathing begins to speed up. You guys watch as his breathing begins to increase. There, you see this faint gray glow approach and stop. Your speed comes to a slow crawl and then halts. There before you, you see this tiny, little mote of gray, pulsing light; a similar undulating pulse as the dodecahedron itself (heartbeat) before you. What do you do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (growling) What do you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (grumbling noises)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (long pause) Do you know if it's achievable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No response. It looks like it's right there, but a foot in front of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's nothing about it that is sensible or familiar; it's totally alien to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is immediacy and forever; it is an ancient concept of possibility. As you ask these questions and begin to contemplate, the loop of your thought process begins to cycle on itself, and you have to shake your head not to be lost in this infinity that threatens to suddenly disperse you. Still, it is this tiny, gray thing before you, and it seems to want your contact.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Lick it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look down and you can see your hand in front of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Father and mother-- I hope I do not let you down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you reach out and touch, you guys watch as this--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did we hear him talking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear him talking. You see a faint mote of gray begin to drift out of the dodecahedron, and then it floats and enters and vanishes into the chest of Caleb.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you feel this tiny mote come into your hand, and then you pull it to your chest, and you feel this warmth, and for a second probability becomes slightly malleable. This object is still so much more than what you understand; its power is indecipherable on the scale of your puny, mortal knowledge, but you do know that somehow, by reaching out to this device, you've managed to pull within yourself a Fragment of Possibility.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does that mean? Fragment of Possibility?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It means he's lucky again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's the Luck feat all over again!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just so you guys know-- well, he'll tell you when he gets around to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No he won't! He will never tell us!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on! Dish.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to him to tell in the story.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a big paper. Let me read it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did we get it too because we were holding his hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. The moment that that enters his chest, Caleb pulls his hand from you. Caleb, your eyes adjust, and you're back in the room with your friends.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Damn it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, are you okay? You went skinky-doodle for a second. Are you all right? Hello? Hello, Wildemount to Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm wide-eyed and not responding.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He can't speak anymore, he's forgotten--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb, we heard you talking, though. Are you okay? Caleb?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eins! Zwei! Drei!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Uno, dos, tres. Quatro.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm literally trying to read this and failing because of my friends.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Quick. Make out with him. True love's kiss is the only thing that will bring him back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think he seems like he's pretty okay, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just make out with him!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter) True love's kiss.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Focus past the distractions.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or you could just tell us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could read it out loud you know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's it say?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never. He's never going to tell us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Player privilege, unfortunately. He's the one who that looked into it. If he doesn't tell you soon, I'll tell you, but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's your right-- I literally still don't know what it does because everyone is talking constantly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you read it out loud then we'll shut up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we'll share

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right! Then we can all be a team.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The dodecahedron of gray faintly glowing crystal is heavier than it appears. This is peer pressure. A set of handles are affixed to the sides and it undulates to the touch. That's all you get. If a hand is placed on the artifact and is concentrated on for one minute, the bearer is granted a Fragment of Possibility. A Fragment lasts for eight hours or until used. A Fragment cannot be granted again until the next dawn. After a creature with a Fragment of Possibility makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw they can expend their Fragment to roll an additional d20 and choose which of the rolls is used for the attack roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once per day it can grant one person a luck point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can pass it around!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ultimately, after an attack roll is made against a creature they can expend their Fragment of Possibility to roll and additional d20 to see if the attacker hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're like chipping away at it? Like an ice sculpture?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is like one luck. That lasts for eight hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It grants you this mote of energy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could literally-- we could each of us every day pass it to a different person and then we could concentrate on it and we could have the Fragment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I able to tell if that is correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gives you-- the Fragment only lasts for eight hours. You can only give out one Fragment per day, so--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Any one of us, one time. It can only grant this gift once a day to one of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, yes. It could be the same person every day or it could be a different person. It gives you the chance that this could be used by anybody in your group.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I absentmindedly babble about what I think this thing can do. It's very incoherent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was that a weird question? Should I have not asked that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What did I say? What do you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You said, "Mom and Dad I hope that I make you proud--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or don't disappoint you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "--and I don't disappoint you and stuff," and also, "gee whiz, I should probably take baths more often."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not-- not that part.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well you were going to say that and then the gray thing went into you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said, "Oh I wish I could share my problems with my friends."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What? That is a very common sentiment. Isn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you ever want to talk about it you can just come to us!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're super good at talking, both of us!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is true. For both of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tomorrow I want the thingy okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well you are in possession of it for the most part. I said I wanted to have a look at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're right. I am.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We can take turns with it. We will decide.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't have to tell the others about this, do we? I mean we're supposed to be a team.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: By the way, I shut the lead cover on the box. Let's put it back in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasping) Oh my gods! What if, now that the gray thing is in

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? Why would that-- no!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not how that works.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you sure, though?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am sure, yeah. Also, with the knowledge that I have and everything that just happened, am I aware-- the gray more that went inside me. Would I know, does that limit this thing's ability to me? Or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well in the description, DM, you said this gray mote went into Caleb, not into them. Can anyone use this thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone can use it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good. All right. Just checking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The next day the gray thing will go in someone else.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right. It's like the little, you know, when you're learning lyrics for karaoke and the little thing bounces along.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We all know what that experience is like.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I think this is a very potent

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or if like you

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You need extra luck for that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a good hypothetical.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, just in case you ever wanted to do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I just say, real quick, before we adjourn, there was something that you were reluctant to do because of your own personal fears, and you entrusted Jester to inspire you to do something that was possibly uncomfortable for you, and it worked out great! I think that moving forward if you want to just go for it! As long as you have trusted friends with you, then that would be a good option to do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is working out. You are, you know, you are capable-- oh dear. I'm going to go to bed now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your son is just the cutest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's not my son!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Definitely heard that. Awkward and weird and makes no sense but I will-- oh, this is my room! You have to go to your room!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sing-song) Okay, well goodnight then!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Goodnight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Goodnight, Caleb-- If you need anything I'll just be in another room--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get out! Just go! Just leave!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The following day, through your various lowkey journeys, you catch another town crier wandering through the town, shouting, "Murderers of the High-Richter brought to justice. By the crown's protective eye, Zadash is free from these treacherous cut-throats!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who was it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who was it who killed her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shouting) "I don't know! I'm just told to tell this!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (shouting) What does it say?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's all it says again!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (fearful shout)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the next morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the next morning.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How do they give you more information? Just a headline; there's nothing else!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's where we're going to pick up next week! (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Victory Pit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to pick up at the Harvest Close festival!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Skydive, baby. Oh shit! What is it called? It's a--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A Mote of Possibility?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A Fragment. Fragment of Possibility.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Mote of Possibility!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done, guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice job, Matt!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to-- no, you should hold onto this because you've got the Haversack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, so I'll go ahead and get those custom items over to your guys' inventory on D&D Beyond tomorrow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Custom items?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll come back next week for a Harvest Close Festival. We get to have a festival.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those always go well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those always go well. It's going to be great!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need to dress up, Matt?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Like we did for the winter festival at our home game?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you guys. You're more than welcome to!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What kind of festival? This is a winter festival?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Harvest Close. It's the end of autumn. All the colors are like reds, golds, browns, tans, yellows.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, do we come in the Ren Faire gear that we own?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll figure it out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll start a brand new text thread.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lederhosen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I own some really nice

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No-- were you? Oh, that's the other pair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter) That's the other pair?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Only him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was fun, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We missed everybody who're out watching Avengers: Infinity War, but we're also jealous because we didn't see it tonight. But! Seeing it tomorrow! Excited about that! Thank you for joining us. Hope you had a good time. We love you guys, we'll see you next week, and is it Thursday yet? Good night!
